intro: Oreorhamnus serrulata, commonly known as the Sierra stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a slightly serrated edge, giving it a distinctive appearance. Oreorhamnus serrulata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and coastal habitats.
